name: Snake Plant
water: Once every 2–3 weeks
description: Low-maintenance and great for beginners.

name: Peace Lily
water: Keep soil moist
description: Beautiful and air-purifying.

name: Spider Plant
water: Water when soil is dry
description: Great for hanging baskets and air purification.

name: ZZ Plant
water: Every 2–3 weeks
description: Tolerates low light and neglect.

name: Pothos
water: Water when top inch of soil is dry
description: Fast-growing and easy to propagate.

name: Monstera Deliciosa
water: Water when top 2 inches of soil are dry
description: Iconic split leaves and fast-growing.

name: Aloe Vera
water: Water deeply but infrequently
description: Medicinal plant that loves sunlight.

name: Rubber Plant
water: Water when top inch of soil is dry
description: Glossy leaves and easy to grow.

name: Philodendron
water: Water when top inch of soil is dry
description: Heart-shaped leaves and fast grower.

name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
water: Water when top 2 inches of soil are dry
description: Bold and dramatic foliage.

name: Rubber Plant
water: Water when top few inches of soil are dry
description: Features glossy, dark green leaves and can grow quite large.

name: Calathea
water: Keep soil consistently moist, but not soggy
description: Known for its stunning, patterned leaves that move throughout the day.

name: Succulent (Echeveria)
water: Water infrequently, allow soil to dry completely
description: A rosette-forming succulent, easy to care for with lots of sun.

name: Jade Plant
water: Allow soil to dry between waterings
description: A classic succulent with thick, woody stems and fleshy leaves.

name: African Violet
water: Water from the bottom to avoid leaf spots
description: Small, fuzzy-leafed plant with delicate, colorful flowers.

name: Dieffenbachia
water: Keep soil evenly moist
description: Features large, variegated leaves. Note: all parts are toxic if ingested.

name: Philodendron (Heartleaf)
water: Allow soil to dry out between waterings
description: A fast-growing vining plant with heart-shaped leaves.

name: Bird of Paradise
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A large, striking plant with palm-like leaves and vibrant flowers.

name: Swiss Cheese Plant (Monstera Adansonii)
water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry
description: A vining relative of the Monstera, with distinctive holes in its leaves.

name: Staghorn Fern
water: Soak it in water weekly
description: Epiphytic plant, often mounted on a board or log for display.

name: String of Pearls
water: Water when the 'pearls' start to shrivel
description: A unique trailing succulent with bead-like leaves.

name: Chinese Money Plant (Pilea)
water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry
description: Features perfectly round, pancake-like leaves.

name: Dracaena Marginata
water: Allow soil to dry out between waterings
description: A tall, architectural plant with thin, red-edged leaves.

name: Prayer Plant (Maranta)
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: Its leaves fold up at night, resembling praying hands.

name: Alocasia (Elephant Ear)
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: Features large, arrow-shaped leaves with unique veining.

name: Schefflera (Umbrella Tree)
water: Water thoroughly, allow soil to dry between waterings
description: A popular tree-like houseplant with a compact, rounded form.

name: Begonia
water: Keep soil evenly moist
description: Known for its striking, colorful foliage and delicate flowers.

name: Cast Iron Plant
water: Infrequently, drought tolerant
description: Extremely tough and can tolerate a wide range of conditions.

name: Fairy Washboard (Haworthiopsis)
water: Allow soil to dry completely
description: A small succulent with textured, striped leaves.

name: Air Plant (Tillandsia)
water: Soak in water for 20-30 minutes once a week
description: A unique plant that doesn't need soil, often displayed in terrariums.

name: Croton
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: Features brilliantly colored leaves with a wide range of patterns.

name: Anthurium
water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry
description: Known for its glossy, heart-shaped flowers and dark green leaves.

name: Hoya (Wax Plant)
water: Allow soil to dry out between waterings
description: A vining plant with waxy leaves and fragrant, star-shaped flowers.

name: Ficus Audrey
water: Water when the top 2-3 inches of soil are dry
description: A trendy alternative to the Fiddle Leaf Fig with velvety, round leaves.

name: Coleus
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: Loved for its vibrant, multi-colored foliage.

name: Kentia Palm
water: Water when the soil is about half dry
description: An elegant, slow-growing palm that is tolerant of low light.

name: Ponytail Palm
water: Water infrequently, allow soil to dry completely
description: A unique succulent with a swollen base and a cascade of long leaves.

name: Ti Plant (Cordyline)
water: Keep soil evenly moist
description: Features colorful leaves in shades of pink, red, green, and purple.

name: Bunny Ear Cactus
water: Water sparingly, allow soil to dry completely
description: A small cactus with two paddle-like segments resembling bunny ears.

name: Lipstick Plant
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A trailing plant with dark green leaves and vibrant red flowers resembling a tube of lipstick.

name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A sacred and medicinal plant in Indian culture, known for its strong aroma and healing properties.

name: Curry Tree (Murraya koenigii)
water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry
description: A small tree whose fragrant leaves are a staple ingredient in Indian and Sri Lankan cuisine.

name: Jasmine (Motia/Mogra)
water: Keep soil evenly moist, especially during blooming season
description: A vining plant cherished for its intensely fragrant white flowers, common in Indian gardens and ceremonies.

name: Neem Tree (Azadirachta indica)
water: Water when soil is dry, drought tolerant
description: A fast-growing, medicinal tree known for its powerful anti-bacterial and anti-fungal properties.

name: Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens)
water: Keep soil evenly moist
description: A popular houseplant in India, valued for its feathery, arching fronds and air-purifying qualities.

name: Ficus Benjamina (Weeping Fig)
water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry
description: A classic indoor tree with graceful, arching branches and glossy leaves. Sensitive to being moved.

name: Christmas Cactus
water: Keep soil consistently moist during flowering, less when dormant
description: A unique flowering cactus with flat, segmented stems and vibrant blooms in winter.

name: Dwarf Umbrella Tree (Schefflera arboricola)
water: Water thoroughly, allowing soil to dry slightly
description: A smaller, more compact version of the Umbrella Tree, with glossy, oval leaves.

name: Polka Dot Plant (Hypoestes)
water: Keep soil evenly moist
description: A small plant with brightly colored spots on its leaves, available in pink, white, and red.

name: Wandering Jew (Tradescantia zebrina)
water: Keep soil slightly moist
description: A fast-growing trailing plant with striking striped leaves of purple, silver, and green.

name: Kalanchoe
water: Water when soil is dry, drought tolerant
description: A succulent that produces clusters of small, colorful flowers during winter.

name: Dumb Cane (Dieffenbachia seguine)
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A classic houseplant with large, lush leaves. Highly toxic if ingested.

name: Money Tree (Pachira aquatica)
water: Water deeply, allowing soil to dry slightly between waterings
description: Often sold with a braided trunk, it's believed to bring good luck and prosperity.

name: Ficus Lyrata 'Bambino'
water: Water when the top 2-3 inches of soil are dry
description: A compact version of the Fiddle Leaf Fig, with smaller leaves and a more manageable size.

name: Fishbone Cactus
water: Water when the soil is dry to the touch
description: A unique cactus with flat, zig-zagging stems that resemble a fishbone.

name: Hoya Carnosa 'Tricolor'
water: Allow soil to dry out completely between waterings
description: A beautiful variegated Hoya with leaves in shades of pink, cream, and green.

name: Zebra Plant (Aphelandra squarrosa)
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A plant with striking dark green leaves and prominent white or yellow stripes.

name: Lithops (Living Stones)
water: Water only during new growth, very infrequently
description: A succulent that mimics the appearance of pebbles, known for its extreme drought tolerance.

name: Oxalis triangularis (Purple Shamrock)
water: Keep soil evenly moist
description: Features striking deep purple, triangular leaves that fold up at night.

name: Peperomia 'Watermelon'
water: Allow soil to dry out partially between waterings
description: A compact plant with round, striped leaves that resemble a watermelon rind.

name: Croton Petra
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A popular Croton variety with vibrant leaves in shades of yellow, orange, and red.

name: Begonia Maculata 'Wightii'
water: Allow soil to dry out slightly before watering
description: Known for its stunning, silver polka-dotted leaves and red undersides.

name: Tradescantia Nanouk
water: Keep soil slightly moist
description: A colorful, fast-growing trailing plant with pink, purple, and green leaves.

name: Coleus 'Chocolate Covered Cherry'
water: Keep soil consistently moist
description: A stunning Coleus variety with deep burgundy leaves and a bright green, ruffled edge.
